title: Several spells of showers expected in parts of the country
byline: The Department of Meteorology says several spells of showers may occur in North-central, Eastern and Uva provinces and in Matale district. A few showers may occur in Northern province.

title: Russia may be responsible for downed Azerbaijani plane, says US
byline: White House spokesman John Kirby has said the US has seen “early indications” that Russia may have been responsible for the downing of the Azerbaijan Airlines plane that crashed on 25 December, killing 38 people.

title: Two businessmen arrested while accepting Rs. 9 mln bribe
byline: Two businessmen have been arrested at Pita Kotte by Bribery Commission officers while accepting a bribe of Rs. 09 million from another businessman.

title: Colombo’s garbage surges during festive season
byline: The Colombo Municipal Council says that there is an increase in the garbage disposed within the Colombo municipality during the festive season.

title: ‘Romeo And Juliet’ star Olivia Hussey Eisley dies at 73
byline: Olivia Hussey Eisley, star of the 1968 film “Romeo and Juliet” and the slasher classic “Black Christmas,” has died, according to a post on her Instagram page. She was 73.

title: Sri Lanka plans to double cinnamon export revenue
byline: The Cinnamon Development Department unveiled plans to increase Sri Lanka’s annual income from cinnamon exports to USD 500 million, doubling the current revenue of USD 250 million.

title: Yoshitha Rajapaksa summoned to CID
byline: The Criminal Investigation Department (CID) has summoned Yoshitha Rajapaksa, the second son of former President Mahinda Rajapaksa, for the recording of a statement regarding the ownership of a government-owned land in Kataragama.

title: FCID to be re-established?
byline: The Financial Crimes Investigation Division (FCID), which previously operated under the Criminal Investigation Department (CID), will be re-established as a separate police division, according to reports.

title: Two including ex-provincial councillor remanded over Rs. 9 mln bribe
byline: The Hulftsdorp Additional Magistrate has ordered the two individuals including former member of Western Provincial Council Sulochana Gamage, who were arrested while accepting a bribe, to be remanded in custody until January 06, 2025.

title: Sri Lanka’s economic recovery must be coupled with India’s growth - Ranil
byline: Combining Sri Lanka’s economic recovery with India’s “sustained and swift economic growth and technological advancement” will “establish” larger markets for the island country and give it a path away from debt-fuelled growth of the last two decades, according to former president Ranil Wickremesinghe.

title: New appointments made to top positions of ITAK
byline: The Ilankai Thamil Arasu Kachchi (ITAK) has appointed former MP Mavai Senathirajah as the head of the party’s Central Committee.

title: Ex-minister Manusha Nanayakkara’s brother arrested
byline: A brother of former Minister Manusha Nanayakkara has been arrested by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID).

title: Gazette issued stipulating maximum prices for canned fish
byline: A Gazette notification has been issued stipulating the maximum retail prices for canned fish.

title: Special police operation targeting reckless long-distance bus drivers
byline: Sri Lanka Police have implemented a special traffic operation during the festive season aimed at reducing traffic accidents across the island.

title: Several spells of showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Department of Meteorology says several spells of showers may occur in Northern, North-central, Eastern provinces and in Matale district.

title: Oral public consultations on electricity tariffs to begin today
byline: The oral sessions for gathering public opinions on the proposed electricity tariff revision will commence today (27).

title: Pakistan military court sentences 60 civilians up to 10 years in prison
byline: A Pakistani military court sentenced sixty civilians to jail time ranging from 2 to 10 years in connection with attacks on military facilities following the arrest of former prime minister Imran Khan in 2023, the military’s media wing said on Thursday.

title: Police Sergeant killed in road accident near Galoya checkpoint
byline: A tipper truck that was being driven on the road collided with a police officer on duty after the driver allegedly lost control of the vehicle.

title: Sri Lankan passenger dies in Erbil after plane’s emergency landing
byline: A Sri Lankan woman with health issues caused a plane to make an emergency landing at the Erbil International Airport in Iraq on Wednesday, foreign media reported.

title: India declares 7-day mourning for Manmohan Singh; Karnataka, Telangana announce holiday
byline: The central government of India has declared a seven-day national mourning in memory of former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh, who passed away on Thursday night at the age of 92.

title: South Korean parliament votes to impeach acting president Han Duck-soo
byline: A majority of South Korea‘s parliament voted on Friday to impeach acting president Han Duck-soo.

title: Former MP Lalith Ellawala quits politics
byline: Former Member of Parliament Lalith Ellawala today (27) announced his decision to retire from politics.

title: CSE’s ASPI continues upward momentum
byline: The All Share Price Index (ASPI) of the Colombo Stock Exchange has recorded significant gains once again today (27).

title: Ranil pays last respects to former Indian PM Manmohan Singh
byline: Former Sri Lankan President Ranil Wickremesinghe has paid his final respects to former Indian Prime Minister Manmohan Singh in New Delhi today (27).

title: President Dissanayake expresses condolences over death of Manmohan Singh
byline: Sri Lankan President Anura Kumara Dissanayake today extended his heartfelt condolences on the demise of former Indian Prime Minister Dr Manmohan Singh through a special message.

title: NASA spacecraft ‘safe’ after closest-ever approach to Sun
byline: NASA said on Friday that its Parker Solar Probe was “safe” and operating normally after successfully completing the closest-ever approach to the Sun by any human-made object.

title: At least 69 migrants dead after boat sank off Morocco, Mali says
byline: At least 69 people died, including 25 Malian nationals, after a boat headed from West Africa to Spain capsized off Morocco on Dec. 19, Malian authorities said.

title: German president dissolves parliament for snap elections
byline: President Frank-Walter Steinmeier on Friday dissolved Germany’s lower house of parliament to pave the way for snap elections on Feb. 23 following the collapse of Chancellor Olaf Scholz’s three-way coalition.

title: Govt committed to providing suitable environment for happy, quality life without discrimination - PM
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya has affirmed the government’s commitment to creating a suitable environment for all individuals to live a happy and quality life, free from discrimination.

title: Galle Fort’s old entrance temporarily closed
byline: The Archaeology Department’s Southern Province regional office has announced that the old entrance to Galle Fort will be temporarily closed from tomorrow (28) until December 31.

title: Acting IGP’s instructions to officers engaged in night-time vehicle inspections
byline: Acting Inspector General of Police (IGP) Priyantha Weerasooriya has instructed all police personnel engaged in night time inspection of vehicles to wear luminous jackets and gloves, the Police Media Division said.

title: Showers expected in parts of the country
byline: A few showers may occur in Northern and Eastern provinces, says the Department of Meteorology.

title: Sri Lanka to observe two-minute silence to mark 20 years since devastating tsunami
byline: A two minutes’ silence will be observed island-wide today (26 December) on National Safety Day from 9.25 a.m. to 9.27 a.m. in memory of all who lost their lives in the 2004 tsunami and other natural disasters in Sri Lanka, the Disaster Management Center (DMC) said.

title: Sri Lanka set to welcome two millionth foreign tourist today
byline: The Ministry of Tourism says today (26) it is prepared to welcome the two millionth foreign tourist to arrive in Sri Lanka this year.

title: Russian region declares emergency situation as Black Sea oil spill fallout widens
byline: Authorities in Russia’s southern Krasnodar region on Wednesday declared a region-wide emergency, saying that oil was still washing up on the coastline 10 days after two ageing tankers ran into trouble.

title: Police Dept’s 2025 annual transfers delayed by 6 months
byline: The implementation of the Police Department’s annual transfer orders for 2025 has been suspended for six months.

title: Sri Lanka welcomes two millionth tourist in 2024
byline: A couple from Thailand who arrived onboard a SriLankan Airlines flight today marked the two millionth tourist arrival in Sri Lanka for 2024, Sri Lanka Tourism said.

title: Sri Lanka Customs to resume clearance of imported rice
byline: Sri Lanka Customs says that the clearance of imported rice which had been briefly halted will resume starting today (26).

title: Deputy Minister claims some police officers paid salaries by underworld figures
byline: Deputy Minister of Public Security, Attorney-at-Law Sunil Watagala, alleges that some police officers are receiving regular payments from underworld and drug trafficking activities.

title: Body found inside burned vehicle in Habarana
byline: A body has been discovered inside a double cab that was on fire in the Habarana area.

title: CSE continues upward momentum with new all-time high
byline: The All Share Price Index (ASPI) of the Colombo Stock Exchange has gained 232.13 points today to close at 15,400.53 points, a new all-time high.

title: Bangladesh to re-investigate 2009 mutiny massacre, role of ‘foreign’ backers
byline: Bangladesh on Thursday ordered a commission to investigate a failed 2009 army mutiny and subsequent crackdown, including the role of alleged “foreign” backers, the inquiry chief said.

title: Japan Airlines’ systems back to normal after cyberattack delayed flights
byline: Japan Airlines (JAL)  said on Thursday its systems returned to normal, with same-day ticket sales resuming, after a cyberattack delayed some domestic and international flights.

title: Govt reveals relief packages for SMEs, assistance for low-income earners
byline: A press briefing on the economic stabilization process and the proposed relief packages for the public was held today (26) at the Presidential Media Center (PMC).

title: SLINEX 24: India and Sri Lanka strengthen maritime ties with successful naval exercise
byline: The 2024 edition of the bilateral naval exercise between India and Sri Lanka, SLINEX 24, was held from December 17 to 20 at Visakhapatnam under the auspices of the Indian Navy’s Eastern Naval Command.

title: Couple nabbed at BIA over Rs. 1.6 billion financial fraud
byline: A couple who are alleged to have committed financial fraud amounting Rs. 1,600 million and fled the country three years ago, have been arrested upon returning to the country today (26).

title: India’s former PM Manmohan Singh dies at 92
byline: Manmohan Singh, the former Indian prime minister who governed the South Asian country for two terms and liberalised its economy in an earlier stint as finance minister, has died, local media reported on Thursday. He was 92.

title: Misty conditions expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department says mainly fair weather will prevail over most parts of the island.

title: President AKD calls for unity and humanity in Christmas message
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, in his Christmas Day message, has urged the nation to transcend divisions and embrace the core values of unity, peace, and humanity, as exemplified by Jesus Christ.

title: Christmas reminds us to reflect, forgive and reconcile - PM Harini
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya, in her Christmas message, emphasized the essence of the season as a time for “togetherness, gratitude, and peace.”

title: President calls for unified monitoring division to tackle illegal migration and drug smuggling
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has held a discussion today (28) at the Presidential Secretariat with the heads of the Department of Immigration and Emigration, Sri Lanka Customs, and the Airport and Aviation Services.

title: Trump urges US Supreme Court to delay TikTok ban
byline: US President-elect Donald Trump has asked the US Supreme Court to delay an upcoming TikTok ban while he works on a “political resolution”.

title: Over 8,000 motorists penalized for traffic offenses in 24 hours
byline: In a 24-hour operation that concluded at 6.00 a.m. today (28), Sri Lanka Police have enforced the law against 383 drunk drivers as part of a nationwide effort to minimize traffic accidents during the festive season.

title: Three from same family injured in shooting in Seeduwa
byline:
UPDATE:

One of the three individuals who sustained injuries in the shooting incident has succumbed to his injuries while receiving treatment at the hospital, the police confirmed.

title: Putin apologises to Aliyev over ‘tragic incident’ with Azerbaijan Airlines plane crash
byline: Russia’s Vladimir Putin on Saturday apologised to Ilham Aliyev, the president of Azerbaijan, for a “tragic incident” which happened in Russian airspace involving an Azerbaijan Airlines passenger plane that crashed on Wednesday.

title: Public urged to avoid panic buying, hoarding salt amid shortage fears
byline: The newly-appointed Chairman of Lanka Salt Company in Hambantota, T. Nandana Thilaka has urged the public to avoid panic-buying and hoarding salt amidst rumors of a shortage.

title: Sri Lankan Ambassador proposes US-style medical school to boost foreign revenue
byline: Sri Lankan Ambassador for Science, Technology and Innovation, Dr. Bandula Wijay says that Sri Lanka must establish a medical school operating under the U.S. curriculum, open to international student enrolments, as part of an effort to brand Sri Lankan higher education.

title: PM inaugurates first phase of China-funded housing project
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya has affirmed the government’s commitment to creating a suitable environment for all individuals to live a happy and quality life, free from discrimination.
